Posts.Content: Oct 19, 2016 02:25AM Rseman wrote: Thanks for the info!! I am starting Halaven on Tuesday and I feel much more prepared. I decided to get treatment on Tuesday despite the info that the next day is rough because my job told me to have my bad days on a work day and have my good days on the weekend when I get to spend the most time with my daughter. BEST. BOSS. EVER!! Celeste it is so hard being on a tough drug when it works. I had stopped my 1st line of treatment (Femara) because of side effects when it was working. I will always regret that. I had no perspective of what "hard" was for me at the time. Now I don't care. If it works, I'm staying on it. Hummingbird it looks like we will be on very similar schedules! So can I ask, how did you handle the first time you lost your hair? Emotionally and physically? Did you cut short and then just shave it off? Or just let it fall out? Was there anything you did to keep your scalp healthy? Thanks for writing! Renee

Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2016 01:25AM Rseman wrote: Hello everyone, It looks like I am going to start Halaven within the next week or so. This will be my first experience with an IV chemo. I was diagonosed over 2 1/2 years ago. I keep hearing conflicting info regarding side effects. My MO gave me a choice to start Taxol or Halaven and I picked the Halaven because he said I wouldn't lose my hair and it is a faster infusion. I'm trying to fit this all in while I work full time. I'm nervous because I don't know what to expect. If anyone could take a moment and tell me their experience I would greatly appreciate it. In the meantime I will look back at previous posts in this thread. TIA Renee

Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2016 12:39AM Rseman wrote: Hello- So I had my first infusion yesterday. Today seemed fine except I felt like I had mild flu like symptoms but with no fever. Lots of pain in my lower back and really cold. I took ibuprofen and it seemed to help but then this evening it all came back. Maybe I should take the ibuprofen on a schedule. I hope you all are tolerating the Halaven
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Oct 25, 2016 05:59PM Rseman wrote: Hey! I just got finished with 1st infusion today. It's so weird. I feel like nothing happened :). I know it takes a while but I feel like I dropped some LSD and I'm waiting to see what happens (although I've never done LSD!!!) ahaha. Anyway, it is so crazy how I am getting conflicting information from medical personnel vs patients on the hair loss issue. Where I am treated the Dr says that no one loses their hair although it thins. However, every person I've spoken to that has taken Halaven has said out right they lost their hair and to assume it will happen. That is the weirdest thing

Posts.Title: Hit by a Train AmyQ AmyQ

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2015 08:17PM Rseman wrote: How is the claritin study going? The pain in my hands has been increasing in severity and how long it lasts and I'm thinking about adding it to my regimen but I hate adding more chemicals to my system.
Posts.Title: Hit by a Train AmyQ AmyQ

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2015 03:58PM Rseman wrote: I may have spoke to soon!! So last night on my second night of Claritin I woke up in the middle of the night with pain in my left hand and my hand was clenched in a fist and I could not open it when I tried to stretch my fingers. Now this all could have been a very weird dream because instead of being alarmed at the time I instead went back to sleep and figured it would all be better in the morning. I'm not sure if that is a rational way to react to pain and not being able to open one's hand!!! I would think panic and the ER is more like it. I am going to pay more attention tonight. But has this ever happened to anyone? I'm going to keep taking the Claritin at least for 10 days to see what happens.
Posts.Title: Hit by a Train AmyQ AmyQ

Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2015 09:10PM Rseman wrote: So I'm still on the fence about whether the claritin is working for me. I just took it for 10 days. I'm going to stop for the next 10 days and keep a journal to see how I feel. I want to see if the expense is worth it. I was still having some pain and trouble lifting my daughter. I see my MO on Monday and was going to discuss it with him too. He said that he could change my medication if the pain was really effecting my quality of life but my treatment is working well and I don't want to mess with it. I can deal with a certain amount of pain when the meds are working. I am learning that I do not deal well with change when it come to this disease!
Posts.Title: Hit by a Train AmyQ AmyQ

Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2015 10:49PM Rseman wrote: Thanks so much everyone!!! You were right Jennifer. I had a sinus infection last week and it was just an inflamed lymph node. It's back down to the size of a sweet pea and the MO said it was nothing. I'll have to remember this the next time I get sick so that I don't drive the whole household nuts with worry. One of my tumor markers are up though and if continues to go up there may be a scan in my near future with a possible treatment change. That I am not worried about!! I feel good and we'll do what we have to when the time comes. I feel a bit guilty that I sent my husband into a bit of a panic. I think next time I'll just turn to you lovely ladies and spare him the worry. I hope you are all doing well and the support was so helpful! Thank you, Renee

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2016 10:31PM Rseman wrote: Hey All--Has anyone run into this problem: after only a week of being on Affinator at just 5mg a day, my nuetraphils get dangerously low. Then I have to stop taking it for a week. My mouth sores have going away because I had to stop but when I started on the 5 mg they started back again. I keep having to get my CBC taken at least once a week now. I'm not sure if my MO is going to want to continue this way if my blood counts keep going too low. Just nervous

It's different when you can actually feel something rather than being told on what is on scans. My husband is going to come with me on Tuesday and going to take my daughter to the petting farm to distract myself :)
Posts.Title: Uh oh new lump in armpit! Rseman Heidihill

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2014 07:32PM Rseman wrote: Hello, I've been on Femara for less than a year and the joint pain is creeping in. It started in the fingers and only at night and is now up the arms into the back and for most of the day. My onc said that if it got to the point where I couldn't handle it anymore he would put me on a different medicine that he said in 50% of the patients the joint pain goes away. I forgot which medication this was but I am going to ask him again when I see him in January. The dilemma I have is that I have been NED for about four months and I would rather not switch medications that are working. I think I'll just deal with the joint pain for now. I hope you feel better soon! hugs, Renee
Posts.Title: Hit by a Train AmyQ AmyQ

Posts.Content: Jan 13, 2015 08:44PM Rseman wrote: I started the Claritin last night. I actually think I notice a difference! I am going to keep taking it and keeping notes. This could be great and I am so happy that this might work. Thank you!
Posts.Title: Hit by a Train AmyQ AmyQ

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2015 02:42AM Rseman wrote: Hello- I actually took Effexor for years before my dx and then stopped. I had no problems with it. I take it now again to help with hot flashes. I resisted at first and then gave in and I'm so glad I did. I think one of the main side effects of Effexor is low sex drive but that is insignificant considering all of the other meds we all have to take. It is something that if you do decide to take that you need to follow the directions and don't stop taking it without talking to the doctor. It's important to be weaned off if you don't want to use it anymore. I hope the information helps :)
Posts.Title: effexor patti4511 Romansma

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2015 08:17PM Rseman wrote: I am loving reading all the good news here!! I had a scan yesterday. I was supposed to wait until June but my blood markers were up, the doctor felt a new lump, and I am having back pain so they decided to get on it. I'm definitely nervous because if it is a progression, it will be my first experience with that. I know it's inevitable at some point but it's still nerve racking as you all know. The doctor said to call him tomorrow for the results. It is going to be a LOOOONNNNNGGGG night.
Posts.Title: Having a scan? Waiting on results? The waiting room is open! exbrnxgrl gramen

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2015 10:53PM Rseman wrote: ugh I called the MO at 9:30 am for results and they said he would call me. At 4pm I called again and told the same thing. I never heard from him today! And he was the one who insisted I call to find out. I'm just holding on to the idea that if it was anything really bad he would have called by now. So maybe no news is good news? Kinda frustrated and so exhausted from the anxiety of it. They keep telling me this will get easier. I'm looking forward to that. So happy to hear about the good news MusicLover. Good luck to everyone getting scans and results tomorrow
Posts.Title: Having a scan? Waiting on results? The waiting room is open! exbrnxgrl gramen

Posts.Content: May 23, 2015 06:24PM Rseman wrote: Hey Starbright, there is a an organization called SHARE and they have telephone group support for metastatic breast cancer. It may be worth a shot. I never thought a group would even help me but now I find I don't want to miss it! I'm not very good at telling people to back off and so I just stop talking to them for awhile. I think my friends are so used to it that they know I'm basically telling them to back off when I do that. It is good to know that we are all in good company when it comes to these feelings.
Posts.Title: Anyone else need to vent? Rseman NYCchutzpah

Posts.Content: Rseman wrote: So I have progression and have started a new medication. At moments it has crossed my mind "what if it doesn't work" I'm not overwhelmed by these thoughts but they pop in every once in a while. I know my husband is worried as is the rest of my family. My friends are aware of what is going on too. So, it isn't helpful that for Mother's Day my mom gets me a pink (vomit) bracelet with a pink bow charm on it. I am not constantly thinking about cancer which is good so why would I want to wear something that certainly make me think about it more than I want to. But I know she was just trying to be thoughtful so that's ok. But then there is the friend who is getting married and all of the drama surrounding her wedding plans. Or my other friend who is constantly having issues with the sale of her house and the purchase of the new one. I am finding that although these are real problems my friends are having and I should be supportive I just don't seem to give a crap. Not only that but I don't want to be around them. So I am avoiding my friends because I can't deal with their issues. I am having a hard time being a good friend. Posts.Content: May 19, 2015 06:13PM Rseman wrote: I absolutely LOVE all of your insight. And am so appreciative that you took the time to write. Life surely does look different and I'm trying to work through this phase and avoid a build up of resentment against those that deep down inside I truly do care for. I guess I am finding that I need more quiet and time to spend within myself to get through this and avoiding the outside chatter is important.
